meanings.definition: To plan or scheme more effectively than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outplot her opponents in the game.
meanings.sent2: The detective managed to outplot the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox was able to outplot the hunter and escape into the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic mind allowed her to outplot any challenges that came her way.
meanings.sent5: In the chess match, he used his skills to outplot his opponent and win the game.

meanings.definition: A plot or scheme that is more effective than others.
meanings.sent1: The outplot of the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent2: The villain's outplot to take over the city was finally foiled by the hero.
meanings.sent3: The outplot of the story was so unexpected that it left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: Her outplot for the school play was so creative that it impressed the director.
meanings.sent5: The outplot of the novel was so engaging that readers couldn't put the book down.
